lessons.title: Health Coaching Foundation
lessons.subtitle: The science of behavior change that transforms lives and builds careers

sections.content: Hey {name}! Welcome to your Certified Health Coach journey. You are stepping into one of the fastest-growing professions in the entire wellness industry. Health coaching is not a trend — it is a fundamental shift in how we approach human health. The old model of 'doctor knows best' is failing millions of people, and trained health coaches are stepping in to fill the gap. By the end of this training, you will understand exactly how to help people transform their health — and build a career doing it.
What Is Health Coaching?

Health coaching is the practice of partnering with clients to facilitate **sustainable behavior change** that improves their overall health and wellbeing. Unlike doctors who diagnose and treat, or nutritionists who create meal plans, a health coach focuses on the most critical and most neglected piece of the puzzle: **actually getting people to DO the things that improve their health**.

The truth is, most people already KNOW what they should be doing — eat better, move more, sleep more, stress less. The problem is not information. The problem is **implementation**. That is where you come in. Health coaches use evidence-based behavior change science, motivational interviewing, and accountability structures to help clients bridge the gap between knowing and doing.

Health coaching is not about telling people what to do. It is about helping them discover their own motivation, remove their own barriers, and build their own sustainable habits. You are a guide, not a guru. A partner, not a prescriber. And that partnership model is what actually creates lasting change.
Why Health Coaching Is Exploding

The healthcare system spends **trillions** treating diseases that are largely **preventable** through lifestyle change. Doctors know this. Insurance companies know this. Employers know this. But no one in the system has the time or training to help people actually change their behavior. That void is creating one of the biggest career opportunities in modern healthcare.
The health coaching opportunity in numbers:
items: The health coaching market is projected to exceed **$25 billion** by 2028
**6 out of 10** American adults have a chronic disease driven by lifestyle factors
Companies with wellness coaching programs report **$3.27 ROI** for every $1 spent
Insurance companies are beginning to **reimburse** health coaching services
The Bureau of Labor Statistics projects **17% growth** for health education specialists through 2030
Over **75%** of all healthcare spending goes toward chronic diseases that are largely preventable

sections.content: Here is what makes this moment special: the medical system is finally recognizing that it CANNOT solve the chronic disease crisis alone. It needs health coaches working alongside doctors, therapists, and specialists to help patients implement the lifestyle changes that prevent and reverse chronic conditions. You are entering the field at the perfect time.
The 5 Root Causes of Failed Health Change

When a client comes to you saying they have tried everything and nothing works, the failure almost always traces back to one or more of these five root causes. Understanding these gives you the ability to help clients who have been failed by every diet, program, and app they have tried.
The 5 root causes you will address as a Certified Health Coach:
items: **Motivation Mismatch** — The client is pursuing health goals for the wrong reasons (doctor's orders, spouse's pressure, social media comparison) instead of deeply personal, intrinsic motivation. External motivation fades fast. Your job is to help them connect to their WHY at the deepest level.

**All-or-Nothing Thinking** — The client believes change must be dramatic and immediate. They go on extreme diets, intense exercise programs, or 30-day challenges — then crash and burn. You teach the power of small, consistent changes that compound over time.

**Environmental Sabotage** — The client's environment works against their goals. Their kitchen is stocked with processed food. Their schedule has no space for self-care. Their social circle normalizes unhealthy behavior. You help them redesign their environment for success.

**Unaddressed Stress and Emotional Eating** — Chronic stress drives cortisol, cravings, emotional eating, and poor sleep. Until stress is addressed, willpower-based health changes will always fail. You teach practical stress management and emotional regulation strategies.

**Lack of Accountability and Support** — The client has no one checking in on them, celebrating their wins, or helping them navigate setbacks. They are doing this alone, and alone is where most health journeys die. You provide the ongoing partnership that makes the difference.

checkpoint.question: What is the most common reason people fail to sustain health changes?

options.label: They lack information about what to eat
They lack accountability, support, and a connection to their deeper motivation

checkpoint.successMessage: Exactly! Most people already know what they should do. They fail because of motivation mismatch, all-or-nothing thinking, environmental sabotage, unaddressed stress, and lack of accountability. That is what you solve as a health coach.

sections.content: Scope of Practice

As an ASI-certified **Health Coach**, your scope is focused on education and behavior change support. You help clients set and achieve health goals. You guide sustainable lifestyle changes in nutrition, movement, sleep, and stress management. You provide accountability and motivational support. You help clients navigate the healthcare system and communicate with their medical providers.

You do NOT diagnose medical conditions, prescribe diets or supplements for disease treatment, provide therapy or mental health counseling, or replace the care of a physician. You refer to doctors, registered dietitians, therapists, and other licensed professionals when clients need clinical intervention. Staying in scope is what makes you credible, protectable, and trustworthy.

revealCard.teaser: See how a corporate HR manager became a full-time health coach earning $7,500/month...

She was passionate about wellness but felt trapped in a desk job. After getting certified as a Health Coach, she started with her own company's wellness program — offering free lunch-hour coaching sessions. Word spread fast. Within 4 months she had 8 private clients and a corporate contract. By month 7, she was earning $7,500/month between private clients at $375/month and her corporate coaching contract. She left HR and never looked back.

sections.content: The Science Behind Coaching

Health coaching is not just motivational pep talks. It is grounded in **behavioral science** — specifically motivational interviewing, self-determination theory, the transtheoretical model of change, and positive psychology. These evidence-based approaches have been validated in hundreds of clinical studies and are the foundation of what makes coaching work.
Can you see yourself helping people finally make the health changes they have been struggling with for years?
What Is Coming Next

In the next lesson, you will learn the **T.H.R.I.V.E. Method** — the proprietary framework that gives you a structured, repeatable process for guiding every health coaching client through assessment, goal-setting, and sustainable transformation. This system is what separates certified professionals from well-intentioned amateurs.

keyTakeaways: Health coaching focuses on the most neglected piece of healthcare: helping people actually DO the things that improve their health through behavior change science
Five root causes of failed health change: motivation mismatch, all-or-nothing thinking, environmental sabotage, unaddressed stress, and lack of accountability
The health coaching market is projected to exceed $25 billion by 2028, with insurance companies beginning to reimburse coaching services

lessons.title: The T.H.R.I.V.E. Method™
lessons.subtitle: Your systematic framework for health coaching sessions that drive real results

sections.content: Welcome back, {name}! In Lesson 1 you learned what health coaching is and the 5 root causes of failed health change. Now I am going to give you the exact framework that transforms your coaching knowledge into a structured, professional practice — the system that has helped hundreds of ASI graduates build thriving careers.

This is the **T.H.R.I.V.E. Method** — the step-by-step system designed specifically for health coaches. When you master this framework, every client session has purpose, direction, and measurable outcomes. No more winging it. No more wondering if you are doing it right.
Why Most New Coaches Fail

Here is a hard truth: the number one reason new health coaches fail is not lack of knowledge or passion. It is **lack of a system**. Without a framework, every session feels like a meandering conversation. You give great advice but clients do not change. You cannot articulate your process, which makes selling your services feel impossible. The T.H.R.I.V.E. Method solves all of this.
With a proven framework, **confidence replaces uncertainty. Structure replaces chaos. Results replace good intentions.**
The T.H.R.I.V.E. Method™ for Health Coaching
This is the exact 5-step framework that transforms you from a well-meaning supporter into a professional who consistently drives life-changing health outcomes.

steps.title: Discover
steps.description: Conduct a comprehensive health and lifestyle assessment. Explore the client's health history, current habits, daily routines, stress levels, sleep quality, nutrition patterns, movement habits, relationships, work-life balance, and most importantly — what they have already tried and why it did not work. Understand their deepest motivations for wanting to change.

steps.title: Evaluate
steps.description: Map the client's situation against the 5 root causes of failed health change. Is this a motivation mismatch? All-or-nothing thinking? Environmental sabotage? Unaddressed stress? Lack of accountability? Identifying the real barrier — not just the surface symptom — is what makes your coaching effective where other approaches failed.

steps.title: Pinpoint
steps.description: Identify the single most impactful change the client is ready and motivated to make. Use motivational interviewing to assess readiness. Do not overwhelm with a 10-step plan. Pinpoint ONE habit that will create a domino effect. A client who starts sleeping 7 hours often naturally eats better, exercises more, and manages stress better.

steps.title: Transform
steps.description: Co-create a personalized action plan. Use habit stacking, implementation intentions, and environment design to make the new behavior easy and automatic. Set up accountability check-ins. Celebrate every small win. Gradually layer in additional changes as early habits become automatic.

steps.title: Heal
steps.description: Monitor progress, navigate setbacks with compassion, and build long-term health autonomy. Help clients develop the internal skills to maintain their changes without you. This ongoing support phase typically spans 3-6 months and creates the recurring revenue that builds your practice.

checkpoint.question: What is the first step of the T.H.R.I.V.E. Method™ for health coaching?

options.label: Discover their full health story and what they have already tried
Transform their habits with a meal plan

checkpoint.successMessage: Yes! Discovery always comes first. Understanding the whole person — including what has already failed — is essential before you can help them succeed.

sections.content: D — Discover: The Power of Deep Listening

Your Discover session is **60 to 90 minutes** of the deepest listening your client has ever experienced. Most people have never had someone spend a full hour understanding their health story, their past failures, their fears, and their hopes. This experience alone builds massive trust and differentiates you from every app, program, and challenge they have tried.

The number one question to ask in Discovery: 'Tell me about all the things you have tried before and what happened.' This tells you everything — what approach they need, what will trigger resistance, and what past trauma around health change you need to be sensitive to.
E — Evaluate: Finding the Real Barrier

Once you have the full picture, evaluate which of the 5 root causes are driving this client's struggle. A client who starts strong and quits after 2 weeks likely has an **all-or-nothing thinking** pattern. A client who 'stress eats' every evening has an **unaddressed stress** problem. A client who has never been asked WHY they want to lose weight may have a **motivation mismatch**.
Common client patterns and their root causes:
items: **Yo-yo dieting for years** — All-or-nothing thinking + motivation mismatch (external motivation driving extreme approaches)
**Knows exactly what to do but does not do it** — Lack of accountability + possible environmental sabotage
**Eats well during the day, falls apart at night** — Unaddressed stress + environmental sabotage (kitchen full of comfort food)
**Starts every Monday, quits by Wednesday** — All-or-nothing thinking + unrealistic initial goals
**Successful in career but cannot manage health** — Identity disconnect + stress that fuels unhealthy coping mechanisms

sections.content: P — Pinpoint: The One-Habit Strategy

This is where great health coaches separate from mediocre ones. Instead of giving a client 15 things to change, you pinpoint **ONE keystone habit** that will create a positive chain reaction. Research shows that when people successfully change one health behavior, related behaviors improve automatically.

checkpoint.question: What is the recommended approach for initial behavior change in the T.H.R.I.V.E. Method?

options.label: Give the client a comprehensive 10-step health plan
Pinpoint ONE keystone habit that creates a positive chain reaction
Let the client decide everything on their own

checkpoint.successMessage: Correct! Research shows that changing one keystone habit creates a domino effect. When someone starts sleeping better, they naturally eat better, move more, and handle stress better.

sections.content: T — Transform: Making Change Automatic
The Transform phase is where behavior change science comes alive. You use proven strategies to make the new habit as easy and automatic as possible.
Transform phase strategies:
items: **Habit stacking** — Attach the new behavior to an existing routine ('After I pour my morning coffee, I will do 5 minutes of stretching')
**Implementation intentions** — Pre-decide the when, where, and how ('I will walk for 20 minutes at 12:15pm in the park next to my office')
**Environment design** — Restructure the physical environment to make good choices easy and bad choices hard
**Micro-wins** — Celebrate every small success to build positive momentum and reinforce identity change
**Setback planning** — Pre-plan responses to common obstacles so clients do not spiral after a bad day

sections.content: H — Heal: Building Health Autonomy

The Heal phase is about making yourself unnecessary. Your goal is to help clients develop the internal skills, self-awareness, and confidence to maintain their health independently. This typically takes **3 to 6 months** of ongoing coaching support — creating predictable recurring revenue for your practice while delivering profound transformation for your clients.

before.title: Before T.H.R.I.V.E. Method
items: Sessions feel like friendly conversations without direction
Giving good advice that clients do not follow
Cannot explain your process to potential clients
No progress tracking or outcome measurement
Imposter syndrome despite genuine desire to help

after.title: After T.H.R.I.V.E. Method
items: Every session has clear purpose and measurable outcomes
Clients take action because they co-created the plan
Professional framework that sells itself in discovery calls
Trackable progress that proves your coaching works
Confidence from combining passion with a proven system

sections.content: Can you see yourself using the T.H.R.I.V.E. Method to help clients finally achieve the health changes they have been chasing for years?
What Is Coming Next

You now have the complete T.H.R.I.V.E. Method framework for health coaching. In the final lesson, you will learn exactly how to get your first paying clients — without a website, social media following, or advertising budget — and build a health coaching practice that generates **$5,000 or more per month**.

keyTakeaways: The T.H.R.I.V.E. Method gives you a repeatable framework for every health coaching client: Talk, Habits, Redesign, Implement, Validate, Evolve
Pinpoint ONE keystone habit instead of overwhelming clients with multiple changes — one successful habit change creates a positive chain reaction
The ongoing Heal phase builds client autonomy over 3-6 months while creating predictable recurring revenue for your practice

lessons.title: How To Get Your First Clients
lessons.subtitle: Build a thriving health coaching practice from day one

sections.content: {name}, this is where everything comes together. You understand what health coaching is and the behavior change science behind it (Lesson 1). You have the T.H.R.I.V.E. Method (Lesson 2). Now let us talk about the part everyone worries about: how do I actually GET clients and start earning real money?

Here is the truth that changed my life: getting your first health coaching clients is easier than you think. You do not need a website. You do not need a social media following. You do not need to spend a dime on ads. You need exactly ONE thing: a genuine conversation with someone who is struggling to change their health.
The $5,000/Month Reality Check
Before we talk about how to get clients, let me show you the math that makes this career so compelling:
The health coaching income math:
items: **Average client package:** $250 to $450 per month for 3-6 months
**Clients needed for $5K/month:** Just 12-20 active clients
**Time per client:** 2-4 hours per month (calls plus prep)
**Total working hours:** 25-40 hours per month (part-time!)
**How fast:** Most ASI graduates get their first paid client within 2-4 weeks of certification

sections.content: Compare that to a typical 9-to-5 at $50,000 per year: that is $4,167 per month BEFORE taxes, working 160+ hours monthly. As a certified health coach, you can match or exceed that income working PART-TIME, from HOME, doing work that genuinely transforms lives.
See what your monthly income could look like:
The Warm Market Strategy

Your first clients are not strangers. They are people who already know you, trust you, and have probably already mentioned their health struggles to you. Think about the people in your life who have talked about wanting to lose weight, have more energy, manage stress better, sleep better, or get off medications. Those people are your first clients — they just do not know it yet.
Your warm market includes:
items: Friends who talk about wanting to lose weight or get healthier
Family members managing chronic conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, or autoimmune issues
Coworkers who are stressed, exhausted, and living on coffee and fast food
Gym or fitness class members who work out but cannot get their nutrition together
Church, community, or parent group members who are visibly struggling with energy and health
Anyone who has ever said 'I know what I should do, I just cannot seem to do it'

sections.content: The Conversation Framework

When someone mentions a health struggle, simply say: 'I just completed a professional certification in health coaching. I am working with a small number of clients right now and I would love to offer you a **free 20-minute Health Discovery Session** to see if I can help.' This is not a pitch. It is a genuine offer of professional support.

In that free session, use the Discover phase of the T.H.R.I.V.E. Method. Ask about their health story, what they have tried before, and what keeps getting in the way. Within 20 minutes they will feel understood for the first time — and they will want to work with you.

checkpoint.question: What is the first step of the Warm Market Strategy?

options.label: Create a website and business cards
List 20 people you know who have mentioned health struggles
Start posting health tips on Instagram daily

checkpoint.successMessage: Yes! Start with people who already know and trust you. List 20, reach out to 5, and offer free Health Discovery Sessions. No website needed.

sections.content: Pricing Your Services

People spend enormous amounts on health-related expenses that never address the root cause of their problems — gym memberships they do not use ($600/year), meal delivery services ($300/month), supplements ($150/month), doctor co-pays, and countless failed diet programs. Your personalized coaching that creates LASTING change is worth far more than any of those.
Recommended pricing structure:
items: **Health Discovery Session:** Free (20 minutes to demonstrate your value and assess fit)
**Single session:** $100 to $175 per session
**90-Day Health Kickstart:** $297 per month for 3 months ($891 total) — 4 coaching calls, personalized action plan, accountability check-ins, email support
**6-Month Deep Transformation:** $397 per month for 6 months ($2,382 total) — bi-weekly calls, comprehensive lifestyle overhaul, habit tracking, ongoing adjustments
**Group Coaching Program** (6-10 participants): $197 to $347 per person per month

revealCard.teaser: See how a former teacher built a $6,200/month health coaching practice in 4 months...
revealCard.content: Andrea was a 43-year-old high school teacher who had lost 40 pounds through her own health journey and was constantly being asked 'what is your secret?' After getting certified as a Health Coach, she started with the parents and teachers she already knew. She offered free Health Discovery Sessions during the first week and signed 4 clients immediately. Within 4 months she had 19 active clients on monthly packages and was earning $6,200/month. She continued teaching part-time for one more semester, then transitioned fully to coaching. She now works 30 hours per week from home and says she has never been happier.

checkpoint.question: What is the recommended starting package for new health coaches?

options.label: Free sessions until you build a reputation

checkpoint.successMessage: Right! A 90-day package gives clients the sustained support they need for real transformation while providing you with predictable monthly income.

sections.content: Scope of Practice Reminder

As you build your practice, always honor your scope. You **educate** clients on health and wellness. You **guide** sustainable behavior change through evidence-based coaching techniques. You **support** clients with accountability, motivation, and habit building. You **refer** to physicians for medical conditions, registered dietitians for clinical nutrition therapy, and therapists for mental health concerns. Your credibility depends on knowing your boundaries.
Your 30-Day Launch Plan
Follow this plan to get your first health coaching clients within 30 days:
items: **Week 1:** List 20 people in your life who have mentioned health struggles or goals. Reach out to 5 with your free Health Discovery Session offer.
**Week 2:** Conduct free 20-minute sessions. Use the Discover phase to demonstrate your coaching approach. Offer your 90-Day Health Kickstart to those who are ready.
**Week 3:** Share your certification journey on social media. Post about the difference between knowing and doing — the behavior change gap that health coaches solve.
**Week 4:** Follow up with everyone you spoke to. Ask for referrals. Consider hosting a free 'Healthy Habits Workshop' at a local community center, gym, or workplace.

sections.content: Can you picture yourself helping people finally bridge the gap between knowing and doing — and earning $5,000+ per month while doing it?

Method to guide every client, and you know exactly how to get your first paying clients. Take the exam, get certified, and reach out to your first 5 warm market contacts this week, {name}. The impact you will make — on their lives and yours — starts today.
